desc:
It was the night before Christmas, and all were in their pews
Folks waited for the choir to sing a song or two
And among them was Carol
In her choir apparel 
And a scarf of a bright red hue
Carol was very bored by those beyond her\nSo her eyes and mind began to wander.
And as she looked around…
She was shocked to have found.

At the back of the church, there he stood.
And Carol could tell he was up to no good
He had dark fur and horns
And teeth as sharp as thorns
And he was doing what no person should
He was taking everything!
From the lights to the tree
He was stealing christmas
How unoriginal could he be
And the worst part\nIt was happening right under their noses\nHow could he take everything, and nobody notice

Nobody except Carol, of course
She saw it all
She had to stop this nasty man
Only she had the gawl.
So the nasty man ran\nAnd Carol made a plan
Ouch! Who's there!
Uh oh, Sister Karen thinks you're up to no good. Don't let her catch you!
Carol had lost Sister Karen \nas far as she could tell
That's when she noticed something on the floor
One of the stolen golden bells
It revealed a path through the church door\nAfter she gave it a ring
The path shot and curved into the dark woods\nSo Carol followed as brave as she could\nJust hope there's nothing lurking.
Carol was cornered \nIt's over, she thought
There was nowhere for her to go
She got a clever idea!
To stick Christmas lights up his nose\nThats when the snowman's nose started to glow
The snowman went from mad to more confused\nJust picking at his nose, shaking it about.\n
Carol said it's impolite to pick your nose in front of a girl
And the snowman got embarrassed before he walked out
Carol turned and rang the bell once more
And it led into a dark cave\nThis was it, shed get back those gifts\nShe went in and tried to be brave.
Carol came to realize\nHe wasn't some holiday thief \nThe man was just a christmas newbie

So they returned church
After marching through the woods
And they snuck past the nun
And returned the holiday goods
They even had some time\nTo sing with the choir
And when carol couldn't reach to put back the angel topper\nThe Not so nasty man was to lift her higher
THE END
